name: intel-mkl

conflicts.name: target=ppc64:
conflicts.description: intel-mkl is only available for x86_64

conflicts.name: target=ppc64le:
conflicts.description: intel-mkl is only available for x86_64

conflicts.name: target=aarch64:
conflicts.description: intel-mkl is only available for x86_64

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Intel Math Kernel Library. This package has been replaced by intel-
oneapi-mkl. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and using this software,
you agree to the terms and conditions of the software license agreements
at https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: cpio
dependencies.description:
GNU cpio copies files into or out of a cpio or tar archive and the file
system. The archive can be another file on the disk, a magnetic tape, or
a pipe.

dependent_to.name: quantum-espresso
dependent_to.description:
Quantum ESPRESSO is an integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes
for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the
nanoscale. It is based on density-functional theory, plane waves, and
pseudopotentials.

dependent_to.name: fleur
dependent_to.description:
FLEUR (Full-potential Linearised augmented plane wave in EURope) is a
code family for calculating groundstate as well as excited-state
properties of solids within the context of density functional theory
(DFT).

dependent_to.name: spla
dependent_to.description:
Specialized Parallel Linear Algebra, providing distributed GEMM
functionality for specific matrix distributions with optional GPU
acceleration.

dependent_to.name: namd
dependent_to.description:
NAMD is a parallel molecular dynamics code designed for high-performance
simulation of large biomolecular systems.

dependent_to.name: xyce
dependent_to.description:
Xyce (rhymes with 'spice') is an open source, SPICE-compatible, high-
performance analog circuit simulator, capable of solving extremely large
circuit problems by supporting large-scale parallel computing platforms.
Xyce also supports serial execution on all common desktop platforms, and
small-scale parallel runs on Unix-like systems. In addition to analog
electronic simulation, Xyce has also been used to investigate more
general network systems, such as neural networks and power grids.

dependent_to.name: gearshifft
dependent_to.description: Benchmark Suite for Heterogenuous FFT Implementations

dependent_to.name: dihydrogen
dependent_to.description:
DiHydrogen is the second version of the Hydrogen fork of the well-known
distributed linear algebra library, Elemental. DiHydrogen aims to be a
basic distributed multilinear algebra interface with a particular
emphasis on the needs of the distributed machine learning effort, LBANN.

dependent_to.name: elemental
dependent_to.description:
Elemental: Distributed-memory dense and sparse-direct linear algebra and
optimization library.

dependent_to.name: hydrogen
dependent_to.description:
Hydrogen: Distributed-memory dense and sparse-direct linear algebra and
optimization library. Based on the Elemental library.

dependent_to.name: sirius
dependent_to.description: Domain specific library for electronic structure calculations

dependent_to.name: gcta
dependent_to.description:
GCTA (Genome-wide Complex Trait Analysis) was originally designed to
estimate the proportion of phenotypic variance explained by all genome-
wide SNPs for complex traits (the GREML method), and has subsequently
extended for many other analyses to better understand the genetic
architecture of complex traits. GCTA currently supports the following
analyses.
